III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth alleged that staff touched her inappropriately.
Investigation Interviews:
On 9/11/24 the agency self-reported an allegation that Staff 1 was
touching Youth A inappropriately on her inner thigh, rubbing her
face, and holding her tightly to his body for too long when giving a
hug. Complainant did not observed the alleged incident.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 9/13/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported that she did
not feel safe at the facility, due to other kids behaviors. Youth A
was asked if she felt uncomfortable with any staff. Youth A stated
she was uncomfortable with Staff 1 because something happened
on 9/6/24. The interview concluded at that time, as it was
determined an interview at Kids Talk was necessary.
The Kids Talk interview on 9/26/24 was observed by DCWL and
MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported that Staff 1 walked up to her in
the gym, touched her face and called her baby. Staff 1 then
rubbed her leg with his hand. Youth A could not recall when this
happened. Youth A then stated Staff 1 never touched her legs,
just her face on one occasion. Youth A reported this occurred
while she was sitting on the couch and Staff 1 was standing over
her. Youth A could not recall which staff were present, but stated
there were two men or two women there, in the basketball area
when it happened.
Youth A then reported she saw Staff 1 rub the thigh of a peer,
Youth B. Youth A stated that Staff 1 rubbed between Youth B’s
thighs while sitting on the couch with her on the unit. This
occurred during the day. Youth A stated this occurred in the gym
or the living room, while Youth B was sitting on a couch. Youth A
then asked, “when stuff happens, do they move kids?” Youth A
again stressed that she did not want to stay at the facility
anymore.
2

Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 9/13/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported that she felt
safe at the facility. Youth B stated she never observed any
inappropriate behavior with Staff 1 toward Youth A or any other
youth. Youth B stated she saw Staff 1 cover youth’s mouth with
his hand once, but it seemed to be in a joking fashion. Youth B did
not interpret it to be anything sexual or weird.
Youth B was interviewed a second time on 10/2/24, after receiving
the information from Youth A at the Kids Talk interview. Youth B
reported that Staff 1 gives side hugs to the kids and they look at
him like an uncle. Youth B stated that she was talking and being
disrespectful toward Staff 1 on one occasion, when he put his
hand on her mouth for a second and said, “girl stop playing”.
Youth B did not feel there was anything wrong with that
interaction. On 9/7/24 Youth B had a bad day. Youth B was sitting
on the couch and Staff 1 sat down to talk with her. She was upset
and crying and he was attempting to talk her through it. Staff 1
patted her leg in a reassuring way, as if to say “it’s ok”. Youth B
did not see this gesture as sexual in any way. Youth B recalled
Youth A was present, in addition to Staff 2 and Staff 3. On
10/22/24 Youth B participated in a Kids Talk interview. Youth B
reported that Staff 1 touched her leg briefly on 9/7/24, but it was
not in a sexual way.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 9/13/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported she had not
observed Staff 1 to do anything inappropriate or that made her
feel uncomfortable. Youth C did not observe Staff 1 to touch any
peers inappropriately. Youth C stated it was rare for Staff 1 to
work on their wing.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 9/13/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 denied the allegations
and stated he was shocked by them. Staff 1 denied touching any
youth inappropriately Staff 1 stated he did not have much contact
with Youth A and could not recall when he last worked with her.
Staff 1 stated he generally worked the midnight shift and patrolled
around the buildings, checking on staff. Staff 1 recalled seeing
Youth A briefly on 9/6/24, after Youth B returned from AWOL.
However, he did not have contact with Youth A. Staff 1 had
contact with Youth B when medication was given the evening of
9/6/24.
3

Staff 1 stated that kids sometimes run up and hug him. Staff 1
would turn and give them a side hug. Staff 1 denied ever grabbing
of covering any youth’s faces.
A follow-up interview with Staff 1 occurred by phone on 10/28/24.
Staff 1 denied touching Youth B’s leg. Staff 1 stated that he does
talk with the kids and try to encourage them, if he did put his hand
on anyone it was not in a sexual way. Although, he did not recall
ever touching Youth B’s leg.
Program Manager was interviewed on 9/27/24 by phone. Staff
schedules were reviewed to determine any afternoon shifts Staff 1
worked, in which he may have had contact with Youth A or Youth
B. Video was then pulled for review and provided to DCWL.
Program Manager noted there were no couches or tables in the
gym. Video review determined Staff 1 was never in the gym with
youth.
A face-to-face interview was attempted with Staff 2 on 10/2/24.
However, Staff 2 was placed on medical leave due to an injury at
work. A phone interview was attempted on 10/29/24 and 11/4/24.
Voice messages were left, but Staff 2 never returned the call.
A face-to-face interview was attempted with Staff 3 on 10/2/24.
However, Staff 3 was terminated prior to DCWL and MDHHS
Worker arrival. A phone interview was completed on 10/29/24.
Staff 3 reported being familiar with Staff 1, stating that they did not
work together necessarily, as he often just walked through the
units on his shifts. Staff 3 never observed any inappropriate
behavior or touching by Staff 1. Staff 3 stated that Staff 1 would
walk through the unit and have brief conversations with the youth,
but did not spend much time there. Staff 3 recalled Staff 1 briefly
sitting with Youth B when the youth was having a bad day. Staff 3
did not recall seeing anything inappropriate.
MDHHS Worker was contacted by video call on 11/8/24. MDHHS
Worker reported the facility agreed to a safety plan that they will
not have Staff 1 return to work until after he completes training
regarding boundaries with residents. Staff 1 will also be shadowed
by another supervisor for one week to ensure proper boundaries.
Video Review:
• Evening of 9/6/24- to morning of 9/7/24: Staff 1 completed
his required checks with staff on the unit throughout the
night. Staff 1 did not have any contact with youth.
4

• 9/7/24 at 7:45PM Staff 1 sat on the couch talking with
Youth B for about one minute. Youth A, Staff 2, and Staff 3
were present. Due to the camera angle, it could not be
determined if Staff 1 touched Youth B’s leg.
• Videos of the gym were reviewed and determined Staff 1
was not in the gym with youth at any time.
Documents Reviewed:
• There were no incident reports regarding this allegation.
• Safety plan dated 9/13/24. Staff 1 was placed on
administrative leave until completion of the investigation.
• The Human Resources file for Staff 1 was reviewed. Staff 1
was up to date on training. There was no disciplinary action
on file.
• Timeclock punches were reviewed for Staff 1 and
determined he worked on 9/6/24 from 6:25PM until 9:00AM
on 9/7/24. Staff 1 then worked 9/7/24 from 7:42PM-7:39AM
on 9/8/24.
Analysis Based on interviews with youth and staff, and review of video
footage, there is insufficient information to support this allegation.
CONSULTATION:
While no violation was found, consultation was offered that staff
should be mindful of how they interact with youth. Touching the
youth’s face or leg may feel too familiar or be interpreted by some
youth to be an inappropriate gesture and should be avoided. A
refresher training for staff may be beneficial.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
